courseContents.title: Spending_001
courseContents.description:
Mr. Santhosh Kumar, a proprietor running a retail grocery shop, plans his purchases on a weekly basis, yet he lacks a systematic method for recording his expenses or income. He manually records all transactions in a notebook.

He has an opening cash balance of ₹17,000 in hand and ₹12,000 in the bank.
His opening creditors amount to ₹25,500 and his debtors to ₹5,100.
As a financial expert, you are required to help Mr. Santhosh categorise his receipts and payments and find out the total amount received and spent during that particular period.


Voucher No.DateTransactions

courseContents.title: Spending_002
courseContents.description:
Gurpreet is a plumber from Himachal who had ₹35,200 in hand and ₹35,000 in bank at the end of the first week of 2024 January. He made several transactions until the end of the third week of the same month. His two-week transactions are provided below: Opening debtors are amounted to ₹5,000 and opening creditors are ₹3,000. You are required to help Mr. Gurpreet categorise the transactions into various heads and also help him find out the total receipts and payments during the two weeks of January 2024.

courseContents.title: Spending_003
courseContents.description:
Ram Gupta, a farmer from Gujarat, made various transactions during the months of May-October 2023. You are required to list out the income and expenditures under their respective heads and find out the actual amount received and paid by him during that period. He had a cash balance of ₹30,000 and in the bank of ₹45,000 at the beginning. (The opening balance of debtors was ₹8,250 and the opening balance of creditors was ₹4,000.) As a financial expert, you are required to help Mr. Ram categorise the transactions and find out the total of all the receipts and payments during that period.


ParticularsMonthDateVoucher No.Transactions

23-09-202373Paid electricity and utility expenses of ₹520 in cash.

courseContents.title: Spending_004
courseContents.description:
Sunitha Furnitures is a retail furniture shop in Kerala. The proprietor has planned to record all the transactions during the month of July 2023. He had ₹13,000 in cash on hand and ₹25,000 at the bank during the period. You are required to help him record the monthly transactions in a systematic manner and find out the amount of income and expenditure for the period of July 2023. His transactions are given below. Provided that his opening debtors were ₹9,750 and his opening creditors were ₹6,000.

courseContents.title: Spending_005
courseContents.description:
Armaan Singh, the owner of a mechanical shop and also a dealer of used vehicles in Punjab, had several cash and credit-related transactions during the first two weeks of May 2023. You are required to help Armaan record all the receipts and payments based on their categories. His transactions are given below. He had an opening balance of ₹12,500 in hand and ₹60,000 in the bank at the beginning of May. Opening debtors and creditors at the beginning were ₹4,000 and ₹7,250 respectively. As a financial expert, you are required to help Mr. Armaan find out the total amount of receipts and payments after categorising all the transactions under their respective heads.
